title: WebKit Performance Manager
summary: The WebKit team is looking for a great manager to lead a software performance and optimization team for one of the most heavily used applications in the world. WebKit is a foundational component of iOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, and visionOS, forming the basis of many key applications.
description: The WebKit Performance Manager is responsible for identifying performance issues and driving development of improvements. You will work with compiler and framework teams across Apple to drive improvements that WebKit can use to deliver performance gains.
key_qualifications: Experience with performance analysis and optimization, Experience planning projects, identifying risk factors, and clearly articulating project status, Experience leading teams, mentoring, and supporting career development
education_experience: BS in Computer Science or equivalent education or work experience
additional_requirements: Managers often build successful careers on the WebKit team without prior experience working in web browsers. Some of these skills can give you an effective head start: Experience with debugging and profiling tools, Experience with C, C++, and Objective-C, Experience with Web technologies (HTML, CSS, DOM, JavaScript, SVG), Experience with UIKit and AppKit
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. The base pay range for this role is between $208,300 and $360,200.
